description: Structured data model for the UK Entitlement Engine. Each entitlement has computable eligibility rules, dependency edges (gateway/cascade), conflict edges (mutual exclusions), and metadata for prioritisation.
v01_note: Only these four situations are implemented in V0.1. Other situations in the 'situations' array are documented for V0.2+ and should trigger graceful fallback with signposting.

person_schema.description: The core data the engine collects about a citizen. Gathered conversationally, used to assess eligibility across all entitlements simultaneously.

date_of_birth.note: Needed for state pension age calculation

entitlements.name: Pension Credit
entitlements.short_description: Top-up for pensioners on low income. The most powerful gateway benefit in the system.

rules.note: Capital over £10,000 reduces award by £1/week per £500 for Savings Credit, but Guarantee Credit has no upper capital limit
Guarantee Credit tops up weekly income to £227.10 (single) or £346.60 (couple) as of 2025/26

eligibility.note: Attendance Allowance is DISREGARDED as income for PC calculation. Receiving AA does not reduce PC.

entitlements.name: Attendance Allowance
entitlements.short_description: For people over state pension age who need help with daily living. No means test.

eligibility.note: NO MEANS TEST. Not affected by income or savings. Key barrier is awareness and form completion, not eligibility.

entitlements.name: Universal Credit
entitlements.short_description: Main working-age benefit combining income support, housing, childcare, carer, and disability elements.

rules.note: Can claim while working if income low enough

elements.name: lcwra_element
elements.note: Limited capability for work and work-related activity

elements.name: childcare_element
elements.note: Covers 85% of costs up to cap

elements.name: housing_element
elements.note: Based on LHA rates for area and household size

entitlements.name: Council Tax Support (Working Age)
entitlements.short_description: Reduction in council tax for working-age people on low income. 300+ different local schemes.
entitlements.application_url_note: Varies by council. Look up at council website.

rules.note: Rules vary by council. Over 300 different schemes in England alone. No national standardisation.

eligibility.the_300_council_problem: Each billing authority sets its own scheme. Some mirror the old national CTB scheme, others have minimum payments (e.g. 20% of bill regardless), income tapers, capital limits, and band caps. The engine needs to know the specific rules for each council.

entitlements.name: Council Tax Reduction (Pension Age)
entitlements.short_description: National scheme for pension-age people. Pension Credit Guarantee = likely 100% reduction.

rules.note: National scheme (unlike working-age). Pension Credit Guarantee receipt = likely full reduction. Otherwise means-tested with £16k capital limit.

entitlements.name: Carer's Allowance
entitlements.short_description: £83.30/week for people caring 35+ hours/week for someone on a qualifying disability benefit.

rules.note: Earnings limit £196/week after deductions as of 2025/26

entitlements.conflict_note: Cannot receive CA on top of State Pension if SP is higher, but underlying entitlement to CA is preserved and triggers passported benefits and carer premiums.

entitlements.name: Carer's Credit
entitlements.short_description: NI credits protecting state pension for carers. 20+ hours/week. No payment now, protects future pension.
entitlements.estimated_lifetime_value_note: Each qualifying year adds ~£300/year to state pension for life from retirement. Over a 20-year retirement, one year of Carer's Credit is worth ~£6,000.

eligibility.note: Much lower threshold than Carer's Allowance (20hrs vs 35hrs). No earnings limit. Massively under-claimed.

entitlements.name: Child Benefit
entitlements.short_description: £26.05/week for first child, £17.25 for subsequent children. ALWAYS claim even if high earner — NI credits.

rules.note: Universal. But High Income Child Benefit Charge applies if highest earner >£60k (1% per £200 over £60k, fully clawed back at £80k). CRITICAL: Always claim and opt out of payment if >£80k, because the NI credit for non-working parent is attached to the Child Benefit claim, not the payment.

entitlements.critical_note: Parents who don't claim Child Benefit because of HICBC may lose state pension years. This is one of the biggest hidden losses in the system.

entitlements.name: Marriage Allowance
entitlements.short_description: Transfer £1,260 personal allowance to basic-rate spouse. Worth up to £252/year, backdatable 4 years (up to £1,259).

rules.note: One partner must be a non-taxpayer (income below personal allowance)
Other partner must be basic-rate taxpayer

entitlements.name: Tax-Free Childcare
entitlements.short_description: Government adds 20% to childcare payments. Up to £2,000/child/year (£4,000 if disabled).

rules.note: Each parent must earn equivalent of 16hrs/week at NMW
Must reconfirm eligibility every 3 months or account suspends

entitlements.conflict_note: MUTUALLY EXCLUSIVE with UC childcare element. UC childcare element (85% of costs) is usually better for lower-income families. The engine must calculate both and show which is better.

entitlements.name: Free School Meals
entitlements.short_description: Free meals for school-age children in families on qualifying benefits.

rules.note: Qualifying benefits include UC with net earned income <£7,400, Income Support, income-based JSA, income-related ESA, Pension Credit Guarantee, Child Tax Credit (if income <£16,190)

entitlements.unlocks_note: Claiming FSM triggers Pupil Premium funding for the school (£1,480/pupil in 2025/26). Even if family doesn't want the meals, registering helps the school.

entitlements.name: Personal Independence Payment
entitlements.short_description: For working-age people with long-term health conditions or disabilities. Not means tested.

rules.note: Assessment based on daily living and mobility descriptors. Not diagnosis-based.

entitlements.name: Disability Living Allowance (Child)
entitlements.short_description: For children under 16 with care or mobility needs. Not means tested. Gateway to Carer's Allowance.

rules.note: Child must need substantially more care or supervision than a child of the same age without a disability, or have difficulty walking.

entitlements.name: EHCP Needs Assessment
entitlements.short_description: Legal right to request assessment for Education, Health and Care Plan. >90% tribunal success rate.
entitlements.value_note: Not financial — but EHCP provision can be worth £10,000-50,000+/year in specialist education, therapies, and support. Priceless in outcomes.

rules.note: Child has or may have SEN, and may need provision beyond what school can provide from its own resources. Parent can request directly — does not need school's agreement.

entitlements.name: Warm Home Discount
entitlements.short_description: £150 off electricity bill. Automatic if on Pension Credit Guarantee.

rules.note: Automatic for Pension Credit Guarantee recipients (Core Group 1). Others may qualify via Core Group 2 (DWP data matching) — no application needed if matched. Some suppliers have their own broader eligibility.

entitlements.name: Blue Badge
entitlements.short_description: Parking concessions for people with mobility difficulties.
entitlements.value_note: Hard to quantify financially — value is in independence and access.

rules.note: Automatic eligibility
Also eligible via further assessment if: can't walk >50m, have severe upper limb disability, or PIP mobility standard with 'planning and following journeys' descriptor E (overwhelming distress).

entitlements.name: Delay Repay (Train Compensation)
entitlements.short_description: 25-100% ticket price compensation for train delays of 15-60+ minutes.
entitlements.value_note: Per-journey. Regular commuters can accumulate hundreds per year.

rules.note: Train delayed 15+ minutes (some operators) or 30+ minutes. Compensation: 25% for 15-29min, 50% for 30-59min, 100% for 60+ minutes. Must claim within 28 days.

entitlements.name: Flight Compensation (UK261)
entitlements.short_description: £220-£520 per passenger for 3+ hour delays, cancellations, denied boarding.
entitlements.value_note: Per flight per passenger. Family of 4 on a cancelled long-haul = £2,080.

rules.note: UK departing flight or UK airline arriving into UK. Delay 3+ hours at destination, cancellation <14 days notice, or denied boarding. NOT if 'extraordinary circumstances' (genuine — not airline operational issues).

eligibility.escalation: Airline refuses → CEDR/AviationADR (free ADR) → County Court small claims

entitlements.name: Bereavement Support Payment
entitlements.short_description: £3,500 lump sum + up to £350/month for 18 months. For under-SPA partners of deceased.

rules.note: Deceased must have paid NI contributions. Higher rate if claimant is pregnant or has dependent children.

eligibility.deadline: Must claim within 21 months of death for full payment

entitlements.name: Maternity Allowance
entitlements.short_description: £187.18/week for 39 weeks if not eligible for Statutory Maternity Pay.

rules.note: Employed or self-employed for at least 26 weeks in the 66 weeks before due date. Not getting SMP.

entitlements.name: Healthy Start Vouchers
entitlements.short_description: £4.25/week for fruit, veg, milk and vitamins for pregnant women and children under 4 on low income. £8.50/week for babies under 1.

rules.note: Must be on UC, Child Tax Credit, Pension Credit, or under 18 and pregnant

entitlements.name: Council Tax Single Person Discount
entitlements.short_description: 25% off council tax for people living alone.

rules.note: Live alone, or all other residents are 'disregarded' (full-time students, people with severe mental impairment, etc.)

entitlements.name: Council Tax Disability Band Reduction
entitlements.short_description: Band reduced by one level if home has features for disabled person.

rules.note: Home has been adapted for a disabled person (extra bathroom, wheelchair room, extra space essential for wellbeing). Applies even to Band A properties (reduced to notional Band minus-A).

entitlements.name: Broadband Social Tariff
entitlements.short_description: Discounted broadband (typically £10-20/month) for people on qualifying benefits. 97% unclaimed.

rules.note: Varies by provider. Generally: UC, Pension Credit, ESA, JSA. Each provider has own tariff and own application. 97% of eligible households are not claiming.

entitlements.name: Voluntary NI Contributions
entitlements.short_description: Fill gaps in NI record to increase state pension. Extraordinary ROI — a few hundred pounds can add thousands to pension.
entitlements.value_note: Not a benefit — an investment. One year of voluntary Class 3 NI costs ~£825 but adds ~£302/year to state pension for life. At 20 years of retirement, ROI is ~7:1.

rules.note: Check NI record for gaps. Deadline to fill gaps is usually 6 years, but temporary extension allows filling gaps back to April 2006 until April 2025 (check if extended).

entitlements.name: Free NHS Prescriptions
entitlements.short_description: Free prescriptions if you're 60+, pregnant, have a medical exemption, or on qualifying benefits (UC/PC). Saves £9.90 per item.

rules.note: Exempt if: age 60+, under 16, 16-18 in full-time education, pregnant or within 12 months of birth, specified medical condition (diabetes, hypo/hyperthyroidism, epilepsy, etc.), on qualifying benefit (UC/PC/IS/JSA-IR), HC2 certificate holder.

entitlements.name: Free NHS Dental Treatment
entitlements.short_description: Free dental treatment if you're on qualifying benefits, pregnant, under 18, or have an HC2 certificate.

rules.note: Exempt if: under 18, 18 in full-time education, pregnant or within 12 months of birth, on qualifying benefit (UC/PC/IS/JSA-IR), HC2 certificate holder. NHS dental bands: Band 1 £26.80, Band 2 £73.50, Band 3 £319.10.

entitlements.name: Free NHS Sight Tests
entitlements.short_description: Free eye tests if you're 60+, under 16, on qualifying benefits, or have certain conditions like diabetes or glaucoma.

rules.note: Free if: age 60+, under 16, 16-18 in full-time education, on qualifying benefit (UC/PC/IS/JSA-IR), HC2/HC3 holder, diabetes, glaucoma, aged 40+ with family history of glaucoma, registered blind/partially sighted.

entitlements.name: NHS Optical Vouchers
entitlements.short_description: Help with the cost of glasses or contact lenses. £39-£215 depending on prescription.

rules.note: Available if: under 16, 16-18 in full-time education, on qualifying benefit (UC/PC/IS/JSA-IR), HC2/HC3 holder, complex lens prescription. Voucher value depends on prescription strength.

entitlements.name: NHS Low Income Scheme (HC2/HC3)
entitlements.short_description: Helps with NHS costs if you're on low income but not on qualifying benefits. HC2 = full help, HC3 = partial help.

rules.note: For people not already on qualifying benefits (those get automatic exemption). Assessed on income vs outgoings. HC2 = full help, HC3 = partial help.

entitlements.name: NHS Travel Cost Refunds
entitlements.short_description: Refund of travel costs to hospital for NHS treatment if you're on qualifying benefits or HC2/HC3.

rules.note: Available if: on qualifying benefit (UC/PC/IS/JSA-IR), HC2/HC3 holder, or receiving War Pension. Must be referred by NHS for treatment at a hospital or other NHS premises.

entitlements.name: Maternity Exemption Certificate
entitlements.short_description: Free prescriptions and dental treatment if pregnant or gave birth in the last 12 months. Apply through GP or midwife.

rules.note: Or within 12 months of giving birth

entitlements.name: 15 Hours Free Childcare (3-4 year olds)
entitlements.short_description: All 3-4 year olds get 15 hours free childcare per week during term time. Universal — no means test.

rules.note: Universal for all 3-4 year olds. Available from the term after child's 3rd birthday until they start Reception. 570 hours per year (38 weeks × 15hrs).

entitlements.name: 15 Hours Free Childcare (2 year olds)
entitlements.short_description: Free 15 hours/week childcare for 2 year olds if on qualifying benefits. Worth £3,000-£5,000/year.

rules.note: Child aged 2, parent on qualifying benefit (UC with income <£15,400, IS, JSA-IR, ESA-IR, PC), or child has EHCP/DLA, or child is looked-after/adopted.

entitlements.name: 30 Hours Free Childcare
entitlements.short_description: 30 hours free childcare per week for working parents of children from 9 months to school age. Worth £5,000-£10,000/year.

rules.note: Both parents working (or single parent working) earning equivalent of 16hrs/week at NMW. Neither parent earns above £100,000. Child aged 9 months to school age (from Sept 2025). Must reconfirm every 3 months via Childcare Service account.

entitlements.name: Sure Start Maternity Grant
entitlements.short_description: £500 one-off payment for first baby if on qualifying benefits. Claim from 11 weeks before due date to 6 months after birth.

rules.note: Must be on qualifying benefit (UC/PC/IS/JSA-IR/ESA-IR) AND first child (or multiple birth). England & Wales only. £500 lump sum.

entitlements.name: Student Maintenance Loan
entitlements.short_description: Means-tested loan for living costs during undergraduate study. £4,000-£14,000/year depending on circumstances.

rules.note: Full-time or part-time undergraduate student. Amount depends on household income, living situation (at home vs away, London vs elsewhere). Repayable from income >£25,000/year after graduation (Plan 5).

entitlements.name: Childcare Grant (Students)
entitlements.short_description: Up to £10,000/year for full-time students with children to help with childcare costs. 85% of costs covered.

rules.note: Full-time higher education student with dependent children. Covers 85% of childcare costs up to max £193.62/week (1 child) or £332.10/week (2+ children). Cannot be combined with UC childcare element.

entitlements.name: 16-19 Bursary Fund
entitlements.short_description: Financial help for 16-19 year olds in education. Vulnerable students get £1,200/year; discretionary awards vary.

rules.note: Aged 16-19, in full-time education/training. Vulnerable student bursary (£1,200): in care, care leaver, receiving UC/IS in own right, or receiving PIP/DLA+UC/IS. Discretionary bursary: applied for through school/college, means-tested.

entitlements.name: Prescription Prepayment Certificate (PPC)
entitlements.short_description: Saves money if you pay for prescriptions regularly. 3-month PPC £32.05, 12-month PPC £111.60 vs £9.90 per item.

rules.note: Worth buying if you need 4+ items in 3 months or 12+ items in 12 months. Not needed if already exempt (age, benefits, medical condition).

entitlements.name: Housing Benefit (Pension-age)
entitlements.short_description: Help with rent for pension-age people not on Universal Credit. Can cover full rent if on Pension Credit Guarantee.

rules.note: For pension-age renters not on UC. Working-age claimants should be on UC housing element instead. Amount depends on rent, household size, and income.

entitlements.name: Support for Mortgage Interest (SMI)
entitlements.short_description: Loan to help pay mortgage interest if on UC for 9+ months. Repaid when you sell your home.

rules.note: Must be on UC/IS/JSA-IR/ESA-IR/PC for 9+ consecutive months (39 weeks). Covers mortgage interest only, not capital. Provided as a loan secured against property.

entitlements.name: Winter Fuel Payment
entitlements.short_description: £200-£300/year for pension-age households to help with heating costs. Usually paid automatically.

rules.note: Paid automatically if receiving State Pension or another social security benefit. £200 if under 80, £300 if 80+. From 2025, taxable for income above £35,000.

entitlements.name: Cold Weather Payment
entitlements.short_description: £25 for each 7-day period of very cold weather if on qualifying benefits.

rules.note: Automatic if on Pension Credit, IS, JSA-IR, ESA-IR, or UC with specific elements (LCWRA, disabled child, carer). Triggered when local temperature is recorded at or forecast to be 0°C or below for 7 consecutive days.

entitlements.name: WaterSure
entitlements.short_description: Caps water bill at the average if you're on qualifying benefits, have a water meter, and high essential water use.

rules.note: Must have: (1) water meter, (2) qualifying benefit (UC/PC/IS/JSA-IR/ESA-IR/Housing Benefit/CTR), AND (3) high essential water use due to medical condition or 3+ children under school age. Caps bill at average.

entitlements.name: Free Bus Pass (60+)
entitlements.short_description: Free off-peak bus travel in England for people at State Pension age. Apply through local council.

rules.note: Free off-peak local bus travel anywhere in England. Some areas offer additional concessionary travel. Also available to eligible disabled people.

entitlements.name: Vehicle Tax Exemption
entitlements.short_description: Free vehicle tax (road tax) if you get enhanced PIP mobility or higher rate DLA mobility.

rules.note: Also eligible with War Pensioners' Mobility Supplement or Armed Forces Independence Payment.

entitlements.name: Motability Scheme
entitlements.short_description: Lease a car, scooter, or powered wheelchair by exchanging your enhanced PIP mobility component.
entitlements.value_note: You surrender your enhanced mobility component (£77.05/week) and get a car with insurance, servicing, breakdown cover, and tyres included.

rules.note: Must have at least 12 months remaining on your award. You exchange your mobility component for the lease.

entitlements.name: Help with Court Fees
entitlements.short_description: Reduction or waiver of court and tribunal fees if on qualifying benefits or low income.

rules.note: 3 levels: (1) On qualifying benefit (UC/PC/IS/JSA-IR/ESA-IR) = full remission. (2) Income below threshold + capital under £3,000 (single) or £4,000 (couple) = full remission. (3) Income above threshold but below cap = partial remission.

entitlements.name: Funeral Expenses Payment
entitlements.short_description: Help with funeral costs if you're on qualifying benefits and responsible for the funeral. Up to £1,000+ for extras.

rules.note: Must be on qualifying benefit (UC/PC/IS/JSA-IR/ESA-IR/Housing Benefit/CTR) AND responsible for the funeral. Covers burial/cremation fees in full + up to £1,000 for other expenses. Must claim within 6 months of funeral.

entitlements.name: ECO4 Home Insulation
entitlements.short_description: Free or heavily subsidised home insulation and heating improvements. Worth £1,000-£10,000+.

rules.note: On qualifying benefit (UC/PC/IS/JSA-IR/ESA-IR/Child Tax Credit) OR via Local Authority Flex referral (low income + poor energy efficiency). Covers cavity wall insulation, loft insulation, heating system upgrades, solid wall insulation.

entitlements.name: Section 75 Credit Card Claim
entitlements.short_description: Joint liability with retailer for purchases £100-£30,000 on credit card. Card issuer must refund if retailer fails.
entitlements.value_note: Depends on purchase. Can recover thousands for failed goods/services.

rules.note: Single item/service cost between £100 and £30,000. Purchased (even partially) on credit card. Retailer has breached contract, misrepresented goods, or gone bust. Consumer Credit Act 1974 s.75.

entitlements.name: Council Tax Reduction (Wales)
entitlements.short_description: National scheme reducing council tax for low-income households. Unlike England's 300+ local schemes, Wales has one national scheme.

rules.note: Wales only. Income-based reduction. Single person under SPA on IS/JSA-IR/ESA-IR/UC gets up to 100%. Others assessed on income vs applicable amount.

entitlements.name: Childcare Offer for Wales (30 hours)
entitlements.short_description: 30 hours combined childcare and education for working parents of 3-4 year olds. Includes 20 hours Foundation Phase + 10 hours childcare.

rules.note: Wales only. Both parents working (or single parent working) earning at least equivalent of 16hrs/week at NMW. Neither parent earns above £100,000. Child aged 3-4.

entitlements.name: Flying Start (Wales)
entitlements.short_description: Free part-time childcare for 2-3 year olds in eligible areas, plus health visitor support and parenting programmes.

rules.note: Wales only. Must live in a Flying Start area (typically most deprived areas). Child aged 2-3. Provides 12.5 hours/week free childcare.

entitlements.name: Pupil Development Grant (Wales)
entitlements.short_description: £225 per eligible pupil to help with school costs like uniform, equipment, and trips. Paid to schools to support learners.

rules.note: Wales only. Child eligible for free school meals, or looked-after, or adopted from care. £225 per pupil per year.

entitlements.name: School Essentials Grant (Wales)
entitlements.short_description: £225 grant for school essentials when a child enters Reception, Year 3, Year 7, or Year 10. For families on qualifying benefits.

rules.note: Wales only. Families receiving qualifying benefits (UC, IS, JSA-IR, ESA-IR, PC). £125 for Reception/Year 3, £225 for Year 7/Year 10.

entitlements.name: Discretionary Assistance Fund (Wales)
entitlements.short_description: Emergency grants for people facing a crisis. Individual Assistance Payments up to £120, Emergency Assistance Payments for essentials.

rules.note: Wales only. Emergency Assistance Payment: facing crisis (fire, flood, domestic abuse). Individual Assistance Payment: need essential items (cooker, bed, washing machine) and on qualifying benefit or low income.

entitlements.name: Help to Stay (Wales)
entitlements.short_description: Home adaptation grants for older and disabled people to help them stay independent at home. Up to £36,000.
entitlements.value_note: One-off grant value varies by adaptation needed

rules.note: Wales only. Disabled Facilities Grant up to £36,000 for essential adaptations (stairlift, wet room, ramp). Means-tested for adults, not means-tested for children.

entitlements.name: Welsh Government Fuel Support Scheme
entitlements.short_description: Annual one-off payment to help with energy costs. £200 for qualifying low-income households in Wales.

rules.note: Wales only. Must be on qualifying benefit (UC, PC, IS, JSA, ESA, Working Tax Credit, Child Tax Credit). One payment per household per year.

entitlements.name: Scottish Child Payment
entitlements.short_description: £26.70 per week per eligible child under 16. For families on qualifying benefits in Scotland.

rules.note: Scotland only. Child under 16. Must be on qualifying benefit (UC, IS, JSA-IR, ESA-IR, PC, or legacy tax credits).

entitlements.name: Best Start Grant
entitlements.short_description: Three payments at key stages: Pregnancy & Baby (£707 first child / £353 subsequent), Early Learning (£294.70), School Age (£294.70).

rules.note: Scotland only. Must be on qualifying benefit (UC, IS, JSA, ESA, PC, tax credits, HB). Pregnancy & Baby: claim from 24 weeks pregnant to 6 months after birth. Early Learning: child turning 2. School Age: child starting P1.

entitlements.name: Best Start Foods
entitlements.short_description: Pre-loaded payment card for healthy food and milk. £4.95/week during pregnancy, £9.90/week for children under 1, £4.95/week for ages 1-3.

rules.note: Scotland only. Pregnant or child under 3. Must be on qualifying benefit (UC, IS, JSA, ESA, PC, tax credits, HB) or under 18.

entitlements.name: Carer Support Payment
entitlements.short_description: £83.30 per week for people caring for someone at least 35 hours a week. Scotland's replacement for Carer's Allowance.

rules.note: Scotland only. Caring for someone 35+ hours/week who gets qualifying disability benefit. Earnings limit applies.

entitlements.name: Adult Disability Payment
entitlements.short_description: Financial support for people with a disability or long-term health condition affecting daily living or mobility. Scotland's replacement for PIP.

rules.note: Scotland only. Age 16 to SPA. Disability or health condition affecting daily living and/or mobility for 3+ months and expected to last 9+ months.

entitlements.name: Child Disability Payment
entitlements.short_description: Financial support for children under 16 with a disability or health condition. Scotland's replacement for DLA (child).

rules.note: Scotland only. Child under 16. Needs substantially more care or supervision than a child of the same age without a disability, or has difficulty walking.

entitlements.name: Pension Age Disability Payment
entitlements.short_description: Financial support for people of pension age who need help with daily living. Scotland's replacement for Attendance Allowance.

rules.note: Scotland only. SPA+. Need help with daily living due to disability or health condition.

entitlements.name: Winter Heating Payment
entitlements.short_description: Annual £58.75 payment to help with heating costs. Scotland's replacement for Cold Weather Payment and part of Winter Fuel Payment.

rules.note: Scotland only. Automatic if on qualifying benefit (PC, UC, IS, JSA-IR, ESA-IR) on qualifying date.

entitlements.name: Funeral Support Payment
entitlements.short_description: Help with funeral costs for people on qualifying benefits in Scotland. Covers essential costs plus up to £1,215 for other expenses.

rules.note: Scotland only. Responsible for funeral costs. Must be on qualifying benefit (UC, PC, IS, JSA, ESA, HB, tax credits).

entitlements.name: Young Carer Grant
entitlements.short_description: Annual £359.65 grant for young carers aged 16-18 who care for someone an average of 16+ hours per week.

rules.note: Scotland only. Aged 16-18. Caring for someone 16+ hours/week on average who gets qualifying disability benefit. Not in receipt of Carer Support Payment or Carer's Allowance.

entitlements.name: School Clothing Grant (Scotland)
entitlements.short_description: Grant to help with school uniform costs. Minimum £120 per eligible child per year.

rules.note: Scotland only. Child in P1-S6. Families receiving qualifying benefits (same as free school meals eligibility). £120 minimum per child per year.

entitlements.name: Education Maintenance Allowance (Scotland)
entitlements.short_description: £30 per week for 16-19 year olds staying in education. Means-tested on household income.

rules.note: Scotland only. Aged 16-19 in full-time education at school. Household income under £24,421 (one child) or £26,884 (more than one).

entitlements.name: Scottish Welfare Fund
entitlements.short_description: Crisis Grants for emergencies (up to 3 per year) and Community Care Grants for essential items when leaving care or staying independent.

rules.note: Scotland only. Crisis Grant: facing emergency (fire, flood, benefit delay). Community Care Grant: leaving care/hospital, staying independent, or supporting a family under exceptional pressure.

entitlements.name: Council Tax Reduction (Scotland)
entitlements.short_description: National scheme reducing council tax for low-income households in Scotland. Can reduce your bill by up to 100%.

rules.note: Scotland only. National scheme (unlike England's 300+ local schemes). Income-based. On qualifying benefit = likely high reduction.

entitlements.name: Free Bus Travel (Scotland)
entitlements.short_description: Free bus travel for everyone under 22 and everyone aged 60+. Also available to people with certain disabilities.

rules.note: Scotland only. Under 22 or aged 60+. Also qualifying disabilities. Apply for NEC card.

dependency_edges.note: AA disregarded as income so makes PC more likely/higher
Cared-for must receive qualifying disability benefit

dependency_edges.condition: enhanced mobility or specific daily living descriptors
LCWRA, disabled child, or carer element

conflict_edges.resolution: Calculate both, recommend higher value. UC childcare element (85% of costs) usually better for lower income.
Age-dependent. Under SPA = UC. Over SPA = PC. Mixed-age couples = UC (since May 2019).
Age-dependent. Under SPA = PIP. Over SPA = AA.
Cannot receive both. If SP > CA, get SP. But underlying CA entitlement is preserved — still triggers carer premiums and passported benefits. Always worth claiming CA even if SP higher.
Cannot combine student childcare grant with UC childcare element. Student Childcare Grant (85% of costs up to £10k) is usually better for full-time students.

decision_points.description: Tax-Free Childcare vs UC Childcare Element — mutually exclusive, must calculate both
If either parent earns near £100k, salary sacrifice to pension may save £15,000+/year in retained childcare entitlements
